Description: Momies d'Ibis, one of two studies for Plate 99 of the artist's 'Voyage dans la Basse et la Haute Egypte, pendant les campagnes du Général Bonaparte', 1802; skull and bones of a mummified Ibis Pen and brown ink, brown and grey wash
Producer name: Drawn by: Baron Dominique Vivant Denon
Curator's comments: Engraved by Pierre Philippe Choffard Denon's 'Voyage...' (there is no copy of the book the Department. The B.L. copy is at 458.h.12). Denon describes on p. 69 of the 'Voyage' how he was shown 500 mummified Ibis skeletons in the caves at Sakkara, two of which he was given and he opened one of them to examine the contents. Lit.: P. Rosenberg (ed.), exhib. cat., Paris, Musée du Louvre, 'Dominique-Vivant Denon: l'oeil de Napoléon', 1999, no. 115
Exhibition history: 1999/2000 Oct-Jan, Paris, Musée du Louvre, Denon 1747-1825
Associated names: Associated with: Napoléon I, Emperor of the French (Napoleon)
Illustration to: Baron Dominique Vivant Denon
Associated titles: Voyage dans la Basse et la Haute Egypte
Acquisition notes: The Denon Egyptian campaign drawings in the BM were lots 892 and 893 (pp. 204-205) in the posthumous Denon sale held in Paris in 1826. The lots were offered together and were unsold at 1000 francs.
